Package net.minestom.server.entity

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.minestom.server.entity.Entity
      • net.minestom.server.entity.LivingEntity
        • net.minestom.server.entity.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CommandSender, DataContainer, EventHandler, EquipmentHandler, PermissionHandler, Viewable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    FakePlayer
    public class Player
extends LivingEntity
implements CommandSender
    Those are the major actors of the server, they are not necessary backed by a NettyPlayerConnection as shown by FakePlayer.

    You can easily create your own implementation of this and use it with ConnectionManager.setPlayerProvider(PlayerProvider).

    • Method Detail

      • getPlayerSynchronizationGroup

        public static int getPlayerSynchronizationGroup()
        For the number of viewers that a player has, the position synchronization packet will be sent every 1 tick + (viewers/playerSynchronizationGroup). (eg with a value of 100, having 300 viewers means sending the synchronization packet every 3 ticks)

        Used to prevent sending exponentially more packets and therefore reduce network load.

        Returns:
        the viewers count which would result in a 1 tick delay

      • setPlayerSynchronizationGroup

        public static void setPlayerSynchronizationGroup​(int playerSynchronizationGroup)
        Changes the viewers count resulting in an additional delay of 1 tick for the position synchronization.
        Parameters:
        playerSynchronizationGroup - the new synchronization group size
        See Also:
        getPlayerSynchronizationGroup()

      • getPlayerSynchronizationTickDelay

        public static int getPlayerSynchronizationTickDelay​(int viewersCount)
        Gets the number of tick between each position synchronization.
        Parameters:
        viewersCount - the player viewers count
        Returns:
        the number of tick between each position synchronization.

        public void respawn()
        Respawns the player by sending a RespawnPacket to the player and teleporting him to getRespawnPoint(). It also resets fire and his health

      • setInstance

        public void setInstance​(@NotNull
                        Instance instance,
                        @Nullable
                        Position spawnPosition)
        Changes the player instance and load surrounding chunks if needed.

        Be aware that because chunk operations are expensive, it is possible for this method to be non-blocking when retrieving chunks is required.

        Parameters:
        instance - the new player instance
        spawnPosition - the new position of the player, can be null or Entity.getPosition() if you do not want to teleport the player

      • setInstance

        public void setInstance​(@NotNull
                        Instance instance)
        Changes the player instance without changing its position (defaulted to getRespawnPoint() if the player is not in any instance.
        Overrides:
        setInstance in class Entity
        Parameters:
        instance - the new player instance
        See Also:
        setInstance(Instance, Position)

      • fillMetadataIndex

        protected void fillMetadataIndex​(@NotNull
                                 BinaryWriter packet,
                                 int index)
        Description copied from class: Entity
        Used to fill/write a specific metadata index. The proper use to add a new metadata index is to override this and add your case. Then you can also override Entity.getMetadataConsumer() and fill your newly added index.
        Overrides:
        fillMetadataIndex in class LivingEntity
        Parameters:
        packet - the packet writer
        index - the index to fill/write

        soundCategory - the sound category
        x - the effect X
        y - the effect Y
        z - the effect Z
        volume - the volume of the sound (1 is 100%)
        pitch - the pitch of the sound, between 0.5 and 2.0

      • playSound

        public void playSound​(@NotNull
                      java.lang.String identifier,
                      @NotNull
                      SoundCategory soundCategory,
                      int x,
                      int y,
                      int z,
                      float volume,
                      float pitch)
        Plays a sound from an identifier (represents a custom sound in a resource pack).
        Parameters:
        identifier - the identifier of the sound to play
        soundCategory - the sound category
        x - the effect X
        y - the effect Y
        z - the effect Z
        volume - the volume of the sound (1 is 100%)
        pitch - the pitch of the sound, between 0.5 and 2.0

      • playSound

        public void playSound​(@NotNull
                      Sound sound,
                      @NotNull
                      SoundCategory soundCategory,
                      float volume,
                      float pitch)
        Plays a sound directly to the player (constant volume).
        Parameters:
        sound - the sound to play
        soundCategory - the sound category
        volume - the volume of the sound (1 is 100%)
        pitch - the pitch of the sound, between 0.5 and 2.0

      • playEffect

        public void playEffect​(@NotNull
                       Effects effect,
                       int x,
                       int y,
                       int z,
                       int data,
                       boolean disableRelativeVolume)
        Plays a given effect at the given position for this player.
        Parameters:
        effect - the effect to play
        x - x position of the effect
        y - y position of the effect
        z - z position of the effect
        data - data for the effect
        disableRelativeVolume - disable volume scaling based on distance

      • refreshVisibleChunks

        public void refreshVisibleChunks​(@NotNull
                                 Chunk newChunk)
        Called when the player changes chunk (move from one to another). Can also be used to refresh the list of chunks that the client should see based on getChunkRange().

        It does remove and add the player from the chunks viewers list when removed or added. It also calls the events PlayerChunkUnloadEvent and PlayerChunkLoadEvent.

        Parameters:
        newChunk - the current/new player chunk (can be the current one)

      • refreshVisibleEntities

        public void refreshVisibleEntities​(@NotNull
                                   Chunk newChunk)
        Refreshes the list of entities that the player should be able to see based on MinecraftServer.getEntityViewDistance() and Entity.isAutoViewable().
        Parameters:
        newChunk - the new chunk of the player (can be the current one)

      • teleport

        public void teleport​(@NotNull
                     Position position,
                     @Nullable
                     long[] chunks,
                     @Nullable
                     java.lang.Runnable callback)
        Description copied from class: Entity
        Teleports the entity only if the chunk at position is loaded or if Instance.hasEnabledAutoChunkLoad() returns true.
        Overrides:
        teleport in class Entity
        Parameters:
        position - the teleport position
        chunks - the chunk indexes to load before teleporting the entity, indexes are from ChunkUtils.getChunkIndex(int, int), can be null or empty to only load the chunk at position
        callback - the optional callback executed, even if auto chunk is not enabled
